Walden Mathews wrote:
> : But in a nutshell, for the one example the benefits are URL 
> structure that
> : models the website's structure and contributing to a more 
> usable website and
> : more directly usable URL structure.
> 
> It's not clear who reaps these "benefits".  But I think you 
> are trying to design a web in which clients learn you rules 
> of hierarchy and then navigate your site by synthesizing 
> URL's by following the rules.
> 
> Meanwhile, URIs are supposed to be opaque from the client 
> angle, and it should by hypertext that is guiding them along 
> the path from one resource to the next.  Have you read up 
> much on these concepts?
